bwwExcerpt: Clark and McAnally’s score, while pleasant and energetic, (the searing power of “Independently Owned” aside), isn’t terribly memorable. Little matter. The cast is good enough to turn pleasant into outstanding. And the fast-flying lyrics are worth paying close attention to. In its titular number, “Shucked” covers 7,000 years of corn history, with a special shoutout to Columbus for bringing “syphilis and smallpox” to the New World and painter Norman Rockwell for featuring corn on many of his vario
